content: The "Public Corruption Elimination Act of 2010" is the short title of this Act. It focuses on the conviction of certain offenses. The "Public Corruption Elimination Act of 2010" amends Section 8312 of title 5, United States Code to include offenses involving bribery, graft, misappropriation of public funds, or conflicts of interest committed by employees after the enactment of the subsection. Technical and conforming amendments are also made to the code. The "Public Corruption Elimination Act of 2010" amends Section 8312 of title 5, United States Code to include offenses involving bribery, graft, misappropriation of public funds, or conflicts of interest committed by employees after the enactment of the subsection. Amendments to Section 8311 of the code include changes to annuity and retired pay provisions for individuals convicted of specified offenses. The amendment to Section 8311(3) of title 5, United States Code expands the provisions regarding retired pay for individuals convicted of specific offenses, including bribery and conflicts of interest. The amendment expands retired pay provisions for individuals convicted of specific offenses, including bribery and conflicts of interest, by allowing annuities to eligible beneficiaries of convicted individuals. SEC. 4. ABSENCE FROM THE UNITED STATES TO AVOID PROSECUTION. Amends Section 8313(a)(1) of title 5, United States Code to include offenses described in subsection (d) of section 8312. SEC. 5. REFUND OF CONTRIBUTIONS AND DEPOSITS. SEC. 5. REFUND OF CONTRIBUTIONS AND DEPOSITS. Amends Section 8316(b) of title 5, United States Code to allow for refund of contributions and deposits if an individual was convicted of an offense described in subsection (d) of section 8312. SEC. 6. RESTORATION OF ANNUITY OR RETIRED PAY. Amends Section 8318(a) of title 5, United States Code to allow for restoration of annuity or retired pay if pardoned by the President or Governor for an offense against a State law described in subsection (d) of section 8312.
